title: Select the True Statements about Normal Distribution
question_text:
Which of the following statements is/are true of every normal distribution?
I. It is symmetric about its median. II. It has Âµ = $0$ and standard deviation = $1$. III. $\frac{3}{4}$ of the data values will be within $1$ standard deviation of its mean.
solution:
Statement I is true; the normal distribution is centered around the mean, but mean and the median are equal in every normal distribution.

Statement II is false; only the standard normal curve (SNC) has $\mu = 0$ and $\sigma = 1$. There are an infinite number of normal curves, each with its own unique mean and standard deviation.

Statement III is false; the correct fraction of values within $1$ standard deviation of the mean is about $\dfrac{2}{3}$.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'A'.
